Birnbaum (mother) | spouse = {{marriage|[[Jocelyn Towne]]|2007}} | children = 2 }} '''Simon Maxwell Helberg'''{{cite web| url =http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/simon-helberg/bio/215955 | title=Simon Helberg | publisher=[[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]]| accessdate=January 4, 2015}} (born December 9, 1980) is an American actor, comedian, and musician. He is best known for his role as [[Howard Wolowitz]] in the sitcom ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]'' (2007–present), for which he won a [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series]], and as [[Cosmé McMoon]] in the film ''[[Florence Foster Jenkins (film)|Florence Foster Jenkins]]'' (2016), which earned him a [[Golden Globe Award]] nomination for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture|Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture]]. Helberg has appeared on the sketch comedy series ''[[MADtv]]'' and is also known for his role as Moist in [[Joss Whedon]]'s web miniseries ''[[Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog]]'' (2008). He has further performed in films such as ''[[Old School (film)|Old School]]'' (2003), ''[[Good Night, and Good Luck]]'' (2005), ''[[Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story]]'' (2007) and ''[[A Serious Man]]'' (2009). ==Early life== Helberg was born on December 9, 1980, in Los Angeles. He is the son of actor [[Sandy Helberg]] and casting director Harriet Helberg (née Birnbaum). He was raised in [[Judaism]], "[[Conservative Judaism|Conservative]] to [[Reform Judaism|Reform]] but more Reform as time went on."{{Cite news|last=Miller|first=Gerri|url=http://www.ajlmagazine.com/archivesblog/2007/09/fall-tv-preview-simon-helberg.html|title=Fall TV Preview: Simon Helberg|date=September 4, 2007|work=[[American Jewish https://web.archive.org/web/20140123005306/http://www.cbs.com/shows/big_bang_theory/cast/41| deadurl=no}} ==Career== Since the early 2000s, Helberg performed with comedian [[Derek Waters]] as the sketch comedy duo Derek & Simon.Fox, Jesse David (September 1, 2015). [http://www.vulture.com/2015/08/odenkirk-talks-to-waters-about-drunk-history.html "Bob Odenkirk Talks to Derek Waters About ''Drunk History'', Drinking With David Simon, and the State of Sitcoms"]. [[New York (magazine)#Digital expansion and blogs|Vulture]]. In 2007, the two starred together in ''[[Derek & Simon]]: The Show'', a web series they created with comedian [[Bob Odenkirk]] for the comedy website [[Super Deluxe]]. They also made two short films "Derek & Simon: The Pity Card" (co-starring [[Zach Galifianakis]] and [[Bill Hader]]) and "Derek & Simon: A Bee and a Cigarette" (co-starring [[Casey Wilson]] and [[Emily Rutherfurd]]) and had a pilot deal with [[HBO]] in 2005. One of Helberg's earliest jobs in television was briefly joining the cast of ''[[MADtv]]'' for one season in 2002. Helberg appeared in the 2002 feature film ''[[Van Wilder]]'' as one of the geeky students for whom Van Wilder was throwing a party. He had a minor role in the 2003 movie ''[[Old School (film)|Old School]].'' In 2004, he was in two episodes of ''[[Reno 911!]]'': Student Driver in ''Raineesha X'' and Hooker Buying Son in ''Not Without My Mustache.'' He had a small role in the sixth episode of ''[[Quintuplets]],'' Get a Job, as a man called Neil working behind the counter at a shoe shop where Paige and Patton were working. In 2004, he appeared in the film ''[[A Cinderella Story]]'', starring [[Hilary Duff]] and [[Chad Michael Murray]]. Helberg played the minor role of Simon in [[George Clooney]]'s 2005 film ''[[Good Night, and Good Luck]],'' where he had one line. In 2005, he had a bit part on ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'' as Jeff, an employee of the film studio where Maeby worked. From 2006–07, he had a minor supporting role as Alex Dwyer in the drama ''[[Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]].'' In 2006, he appeared in a series of comical TV commercials for [[Richard Branson]]'s UK financial services company ''[[Virgin Money UK|Virgin Money]].'' He played a small role in the 2007 film ''[[Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story]]'' as a Jewish record producer. In 2007, Helberg was cast as [[Howard Wolowitz]],{{cite web|last= Quillard|first= Bobby|url= http://www.venuszine.com/articles/art_and_culture/tv/7469/Talk_Nerdy_to_Me_Simon_Helberg_of_The_Big_Bang_Theory| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110717185009/http://www.venuszine.com/articles/art_and_culture/tv/7469/Talk_Nerdy_to_Me_Simon_Helberg_of_The_Big_Bang_Theory|archivedate=July 17, 2011|title=Talk Nerdy to Me: Simon Helberg of The Big Bang Theory|date=August 16, 2010|work=[[Venus Zine]]|accessdate=October 19, 2012}} in the CBS comedy series ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]''. He appeared as the character Moist in ''[[Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog]],'' and had a small role in the [[television pilot|pilot episode]] of the [[Judd Apatow]]-produced sitcom ''[[Undeclared]]''. In the 2009 [[Coen brothers]] film ''[[A Serious Man]]'', he played junior Rabbi Scott Ginsler. He had a minor role in the season 4 finale of ''[[The Guild (web series)|The Guild]]'' as one of the Game Masters. In 2016, Helberg starred alongside [[Meryl Streep]] and [[Hugh Grant]] in ''[[Florence Foster Jenkins (film)|Florence Foster Jenkins]]'', directed by [[Stephen Frears]]; he played pianist [[Cosmé McMoon]] and his performance was nominated for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture]].{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4136084/|title=Florence Foster Jenkins | access-date= August 12, 2016|publisher= Internet Movie Database|website= IMDb.com}} ==Personal life== Helberg married actress [[Jocelyn Towne]] on July 15, 2007.{{cite news | url= http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2014/03/12/simon-helberg-gets-together-with-his-real-life-wife-jocelyn-towne-to-direct-a-movie-on-their-romance/| title=Simon Helberg Gets Together With His Real Life Wife Jocelyn Towne To Direct A Movie – On Their Romance | date= March 12, 2014 |accessdate= January 4, 2015|first=Gali |last=Raz|work=[[Jewish Business News]] | archivedate= July 12, 2014 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140712224728/http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2014/03/12/simon-helberg-gets-together-with-his-real-life-wife-jocelyn-towne-to-direct-a-movie-on-their-romance/ | deadurl=no}} Note: Webber, ''Us Weekly'' (below), gives marriage year as 2012. Towne's uncle is screenwriter [[Robert Towne]].{{cite web|url=http://www.scriptmag.com/features/balls-of-steel-i-am-i-and-then-some |title=Balls of Steel: I Am I ... and Then Some – Script Magazine |publisher=Scriptmag.com |first= Jeanne Veillette |last=Bowerman | date= August 18, 2011 |accessdate=2014-05-09 | archivedate= November 9, 2014 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141109221326/http://www.scriptmag.com/features/balls-of-steel-i-am-i-and-then-some| deadurl=no}} Helberg and Towne's first child, daughter Adeline, was born on May 8, 2012.{{cite web|first=Sarah |last=Michaud |first2= Monica |last2= Rizzo|url= http://celebritybabies.people.com/2012/01/27/the-big-bang-theory-simon-helberg-expecting-first-child/| title= Baby on the Way for Simon Helberg|date=January 27, 2012|work=[[People (magazine) |People]] |accessdate=January 27, 2012}} A son, Wilder Towne Helberg, was born on April 23, 2014.{{cite news| url = http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-moms/news/simon-helberg-wife-jocelyn-towne-welcome-baby-boy-wilder-helberg--2014246 | title=Simon Helberg and Wife Jocelyn Towne Welcome Second Child, Baby Boy Wilder Towne Helberg| work=[[Us Weekly]] | date= June 24, 2014| first=Stephanie|last=Webber|accessdate= January 4, 2015}} On May 14, 2013, Helberg revealed on ''[[Norm Macdonald Live]]'' that he has a [[black belt (martial arts)|black belt]] in [[karate]]. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
